Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Agriculture if it is his intention to extend to all sheep flocks in the disadvantaged areas the same headage rates and regulations as operate at present for mountain sheep (£9.50 for the first 150 ewes and £6.50 for the next 50 ewes at the 1981 rates).

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Agriculture (Mr. Lenihan) Brian (Snr.) Lenihan
Speaker.P: The relevant EEC directive lays down the requirement that the level of headage payments rates be set by reference to the degree of permanent natural handicap affecting farming activities which is suffered by any particular area.

As the degree of permanent natural handicap in mountain areas is obviously greater than that suffered by lowland areas, some differentiation in treatment between those areas must be maintained as indeed applied under the previous administration.

asked the Minister for Agriculture if, in view of the manifest unfairness of the present system whereby a farmer with as little as 50p in off-farm income in excess of the comparable income loses his entire headage payments, he will change the regulations to enable affected farmers to get headage payments less the amount by which off-farm income exceeds the comparable income.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Agriculture (Mr. Lenihan) Brian (Snr.) Lenihan

Speaker.hpid: Mr. J. Bruton Mr. J. Bruton

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Public Service (Mr. Gene Fitzgerald) Minister for the Public Service (Mr. Gene Fitzgerald)
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for the Public Service (Mr. Gene Fitzgerald)
Speaker.P: The final draft of the new comprehensive scheme for transferring service for superannuation purposes has been circulated to all organisations covered by the existing arrangements for transferring pension rights, asking them to indicate whether they are prepared to accept its terms. Other public sector organisations were also circulated. Definitive replies are still outstanding from a small number of organisations. The attached schedule shows the position in relation to each of the semi-State bodies circulated.

The terms of the new scheme provide that organisations may participate with effect from an agreed date which must be not earlier than 1 June 1973. A person transferring between two participating organisations on or after the relevant operative date would automatically benefit; the scheme may also be applied, at the discretion of the final employing organisation, to persons who transferred before the operative date and are still serving on that date, and, in so far as pensions are concerned, to persons who retired before the operative date. Pending the formal implementation of the scheme it is open to each organisation in paragraph 1 of the schedule to operate the new arrangements on a provisional basis in relation to any other organisation listed in that paragraph.

As indicated in the schedule, most of the organisations concerned have accepted the new scheme and the majority of those who are still considering the position have indicated that they are, in principle, favourably disposed towards it. The scheme will have a vital role to play in furthering mobility of labour within the public sector and its importance in this respect has been brought to the attention of the organisations concerned. However, it will be appreciated that general policy on the operational independence of semi-State bodies requires that each organisation, after considering the alternatives and the stated preference of my Department, should be allowed to take its own decision as to whether, and on what basis, it would join the scheme.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Posts and Telegraphs his Department's present attitude to pirate radio stations.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Posts and Telegraphs (Mr. Wilson) John P. Wilson
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for Posts and Telegraphs (Mr. Wilson)
Speaker.P: These stations are illegal as they operate in breach of the Wireless Telegraphy Act, 1926, which regulates the use of wireless telegraphy apparatus.

They are also in breach of international agreements regarding the use of the radio frequency spectrum. It is my intention shortly to seek the approval of this House for new legislation which will enable my Department to close down these stations.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Posts and Telegraphs (Mr. Wilson) John P. Wilson
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for Posts and Telegraphs (Mr. Wilson)
Speaker.P: I would refer the Deputy to my statement on this matter in my opening speech on the Second Stage of the Postal and Telecommunications Services Bill, 1982 (Official Report of 19 May 1982, col. 1587).

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education if he will make a statement on the proposal to build a permanent extension to Whitechurch national school, County Waterford; if he is aware of the serious state of disrepair of the two prefabricated buildings attached to this school and that one of the prefabricated buildings had to be closed during the recent bad weather; if, in these circumstances, he will give an undertaking to the House that a permanent extension will be built without delay; and if he will also make a statement on the position as a result of the recent deputation he received.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Professor O'Donoghue) Minister for Education (Professor O'Donoghue)
Speaker.P: I would direct the Deputy's attention to my reply of 1 April 1982, to a previous question concerning a permanent extension to Ballinameela national school, County Waterford, and the sanctioning of a grant by my Department towards improvements and repairs to the prefabricated classrooms.

MainHeading.P: With regard to the prefabricated classrooms, I understand from the Commissioners of Public Works that they have advised the chairman to seek tenders for the necessary works and they await the submission of tenders. In addition, having discussed the case recently with a deputation from the area, I have asked my Department to investigate other possibilities with the aim of ensuring that suitable accommodation is available for the pupils of the school for the coming school year.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. H. Byrne Mr. H. Byrne
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Health if he will appoint a consultant paediatrician to Wexford County Hospital, as it is essential that a hospital in which up to 2,000 babies are delivered per year should have a full-time consultant paediatrician.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. H. Byrne Mr. H. Byrne
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Health when he will appoint a consultant pathologist with direct responsibility for all pathology services in Wexford County Hospital in view of the recommendation in the Comhairle na nOspidéal document on consultant manpower projections up to 1981.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Health (Dr. Woods) Minister for Health (Dr. Woods)
Speaker.P: With the permission of the Ceann Comhairle I propose to take Questions Nos. 505 and 506 together.

Approval to the appointment of a pathologist and a paediatrician at Wexford County Hospital is a matter in the first instance for Comhairle na nOspidéal whose statutory function it is to regulate the number and type of consultant medical staffs. I understand that the South Eastern Health Board have not applied to the Comhairle for approval to the appointment of a pathologist or paediatrician at Wexford County Hospital.

The South-Eastern Health Board are, however, considering developments at Wexford County Hospital including a paediatric service and, in the event of such development going ahead, it will be a matter for the Comhairle to approve the creation of a post of paediatrician.
In the case of the pathology service this is at present provided on a regional basis from Ardkeen Hospital and I understand the health board have no proposal to change this arrangement.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. H. Byrne Mr. H. Byrne
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Health when he will provide a new theatre in Wexford County Hospital.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. H. Byrne Mr. H. Byrne
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Health when he will provide an intensive care unit and recovery room in Wexford County Hospital.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Health (Dr. Woods) Minister for Health (Dr. Woods)
Speaker.P: I propose to take Questions Nos. 507 and 508 together.

A development control plan for the County Hospital, Wexford, was approved in 1980. In December 1981 the health board sought approval for the erection of a new theatre suite at the rear of the existing hospital. The board also proposed the adaptation of the existing theatre area as an intensive care unit. These proposals are not in accordance with what is envisaged in the development control plan and the board have been asked to examine the feasibility of constructing improved surgical facilities in accordance with the development control plan.

I accept the need for such facilities. As the capital and revenue costs involved in providing them are very substantial, I regret that in view of the current, difficult financial climate. I cannot at this time, give any precise indication as to when they can be provided. I will, however, keep the situation under review.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. H. Byrne Mr. H. Byrne
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Health when he will appoint two radiographers to Wexford County Hospital in view of the vast discrepancy between the national average which is 1:39,000 but 1:100,000 in County Wexford.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Health (Dr. Woods) Minister for Health (Dr. Woods)
Speaker.P: From the statistics mentioned I assume that the Deputy is referring to radiologists and not radiographers of which six are employed in Wexford County Hospital giving a ratio of one to 16,500 population. There is one radiologist employed and Comhairle na nOspidéal have approved a second post which has not yet been cleared by the Department for funding purposes. The position is being kept under review.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. H. Byrne Mr. H. Byrne
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Health when he will sanction the purchase of a model S5 coulter counter for Wexford County Hospital as patient care at the hospital is suffering as a result of the long delay in the decision to purchase the counter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Health (Dr. Woods) Minister for Health (Dr. Woods)
Speaker.P: The provision of laboratory equipment such as a coulter counter for Wexford County Hospital is primarily a matter for the South Eastern Health Board.

I am aware that the purchase of this equipment, and its cost implications, are being actively examined by the board at present and any proposals for the provision of this equipment will be fully considered in the light of the resource available to me.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. H. Byrne Mr. H. Byrne
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Health when he will provide a proper bed and passenger lift for the surgical unit of Wexford County Hospital, since there are two tower wards accommodating 41 patients and all operation cases are taken up two flights of stairs to the wards on a canvas stretcher supported by two long poles.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Health (Dr. Woods) Minister for Health (Dr. Woods)
Speaker.P: This is a matter for the health board in the first instance and my Department have received no specific proposals from the health board for the provision of a bed-passenger lift at the hospital.

I am aware of the difficulties in relation to moving post-operative cases in Wexford County Hospital and any proposal from the health board to my Department in relation to this matter will be given very careful consideration in the context of the resource available to me.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Incontinence Sheets Supply Irregularities.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. J. Bruton Mr. J. Bruton
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Health if he stated at a recent conference of the Pharmaceutical Union in Galway that there had been irregularities in the supply through pharmacists of incontinence sheets; the number of pharmacists that he suspects were involved in the irregularities; if any prosecutions will be taken in regard to the matter; if the matter has been referred to the Garda authorities or to the Director of Public Prosecutions; and if he intends to take any further action on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Health (Dr. Woods) Minister for Health (Dr. Woods)
Speaker.P: In my address to the Annual General Meeting of the Irish Pharmaceutical Union in May, I referred to irregularities in the supply of incontinence sheets. It is not a matter of suspecting pharmacists — the monitoring procedures which identified the problem initially are still continuing. A small number of persons have been referred so far to the Garda for further investigation and it will be a matter for the Director of Public Prosecution to determine whether there should be further proceedings. Since 1 March last, incontinence sheets are no longer being dispensed through retail pharmacies for the General Medical Service.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. R. Bruton Mr. R. Bruton
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Health (i) the number of people in the State suffering from Addison's disease; (ii) the cost per annum of extending the cover for drugs and medicine afforded to other long-term ailments to include this disease; and (iii) if he will consider extending the coverage of long-term ailments to include this disease.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Health (Dr. Woods) Minister for Health (Dr. Woods)
Speaker.P: It is not possible to state precisely the number of people suffering from Addison's disease, in part because of difficulties in diagnosis. Therefore, it is not possible to state the annual cost of its inclusion in the long-term illness scheme.
Addison's disease is one of a number of conditions which have been considered for inclusion in the scheme, from time to time. I will keep this matter under review in the light of available resources.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Kilkenny Employment Exchange.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Social Welfare if he is aware of the serious lack of space and facilities at the employment exchange in Kilkenny city because of the increasing number of unemployed; and, if so, when more suitable premises will be provided.

asked the Minister for Social Welfare if he is aware of the inadequate and difficult conditions the staff at the employment exchange in Kilkenny work under; and the action he is taking to improve the situation.

asked the Minister for Social Welfare if he is aware of the inadequate accommodation for persons claiming unemployment benefit and assistance at the employment exchange in Kilkenny; and the action he is taking to improve the situation.

asked the Minister for Social Welfare if he is aware of the following deficiencies in Kilkenny Employment exchange: (1) insufficient space behind the counter; (2) inadequate working facilities (no desks)— all work has to be performed at counter in cramped conditions, that is, signing boxes and so on; (3) no proper filing facilities for unemployment assistance papers and lapsed claims; (4) only one electric socket for the entire office; (5) the counter is too high and antiquated chairs; (6) toilet facilities are very poor — only one toilet which is shared with upstairs staff; (7) canteen facilities non-existent, except for a bucket under the counter; (8) no wash-up area; (9) building badly in need of painting; (10) no alarm system; (11) no facilities for filing current hatch claims near counter—boxes have to be carried daily; (12) workload very heavy, seven persons on staff and they are on continuous overtime; and (13) the building is inadequate to accommodate numbers signing; and if he will make a statement on the immediate steps he proposes to remedy this situation.
asked the Minister for Social Welfare the steps he proposes to take to provide adequate and humane facilities for people signing at the Kilkenny employment exchange.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Social Welfare (Dr. Woods) Michael J. Woods
Speaker.P: I propose to take Questions Nos. 527 to 531, inclusive, together.

I am aware that the present accommodation and facilities at the employment exchange in Kilkenny are not fully satisfactory. The intention is to provide a completely new employment exchange in the new Government offices which the Commissioners of Public Works are arranging to have built in Kilkenny at Old Callan Road. Pending the building of the new offices efforts are being made to find suitable temporary alternative premises for the employment exchange. To date such efforts have not been successful but the obtaining of suitable temporary premises will continue to be pursued and in the meantime steps are being taken to improve the conditions as far as possible in the present employment exchange.

MainHeading.P: I wish to assure the Deputy of my concern about the position in the present employment exchange and of my intention to have proper employment exchange facilities provided in Kilkenny as soon as possible.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Community Work for Unemployed.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. J. Bruton Mr. J. Bruton
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Social Welfare if he is aware of studies, or experiments, in other countries such as the United Kingdom and the Netherlands whereby those who sign for unemployment benefit are involved in constructive work on behalf of the community rather than encouraged to remain entirely idle; and his attitude towards such experiments.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Social Welfare (Dr. Woods) Michael J. Woods
Speaker.P: I have seen in recent times references to the studies and experiments referred to by the Deputy and I am having them studied. Any action that might be taken would have to be assessed having regard to relevance to the circumstances of this country. Consultation would also be necessary with other Government Departments and State organisations concerned. Meanwhile the Government have set up a working party to urgently explore the role which public work programmes could play in providing an alternative to unemployment.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Water and Sewerage Schemes.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. S. Brennan Mr. S. Brennan
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for the Environment when he intends to provide sewage facilities for the Edmonstown area of County Dublin in view of the hardship experienced in particular by old age people there; and when he will order the start of the Rockbrook/Ballyboden scheme.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Raphael Burke) Raphael P. Burke
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Raphael Burke)
Speaker.P: The area of Edmonstown will be drained to Rockbrook sewer. Working drawings for this scheme, known as the Rockbrook Road cottages drainage scheme, were approved on 11 May 1981. I sanctioned a loan for £190,700 on 8 June 1981 and a supplementary loan for £172,300 on 6 April 1982. Arrangements for carrying out the work are a matter for the county council.
asked the Minister for the Environment if a house improvement grant will be approved for a person (details supplied) in Enniscorthy, County Wexford.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Raphael Burke) Raphael P. Burke
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Raphael Burke)
Speaker.P: A house improvement grant has been approved in this case.

asked the Minister for the Environment if, in view of the serious recession in the tourist industry, he will consider the provision of some financial relief for hotel owners and guesthouse owners in relation to rates.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Raphael Burke) Raphael P. Burke
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Raphael Burke)
Speaker.P: Under the Local Government (Financial Provisions) Act, 1978, the rated occupiers of hotels and guesthouses, registered under the Tourist Traffic Acts, 1939 to 1975, may apply to the local authorities for relief of a proportion of their rates provided part of their premises is used wholly for ordinary dwelling purposes. I have no proposals to extend this relief to the commercial element of their premises. If individual hotel or guesthouse owners have difficulties in paying their rates it is, of course, open to them to make their case to the local authority.
asked the Minister for the Environment when a £1,000 new house grant and a £3,000 mortgage subsidy will be paid to a person (details supplied) in Tuam, County Galway.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Raphael Burke) Raphael P. Burke
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Raphael Burke)
Speaker.P: The grant will be paid when an inspection establishes that the house has been satisfactorily completed and occupied and that the other conditions applying to the grant scheme have been complied with.
The question of payment of the subsidy does not arise until the £1,000 grant has been paid and six months have elapsed from the date of execution of the mortgage deed.
asked the Minister for the Environment if he has given a special allocation of finance for the Ring Road around Mount Brandon.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Raphael Burke) Raphael P. Burke
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Raphael Burke)
Speaker.P: No proposals have been made to me in this matter and accordingly the question of financing such a proposal has not arisen.

asked the Minister for Fisheries and Forestry the up-to-date position of the proposed repair and development of Moville Pier, County Donegal.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Fisheries and Forestry (Mr. Daly) Brendan Daly
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for Fisheries and Forestry (Mr. Daly)
Speaker.P: Moville Pier is vested in the Harbour Commissioners for the port of Derry. The cost of the present structure was met by my Department with a small contribution from the Harbour Commissioners who agreed to accept responsibility for repair and maintenance. The Department are in correspondence with the Harbour Commissioners with a view to having repairs to the pier carried out as quickly as possible. I have no proposals for the further development of Moville Pier.
asked the Minister for Fisheries and Forestry the up-to-date position of the proposed development of Portmore Pier, Malin Head, County Donegal.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Fisheries and Forestry (Mr. Daly) Brendan Daly
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for Fisheries and Forestry (Mr. Daly)
Speaker.P: During the past year my Department made a grant towards the cost of an electrically operated crane and two recessed ladders provided at a total cost of £40,000.

A major development scheme for this harbour sought by local fishermen has been given full consideration by my Department but it was decided that the low level of fishing from Portmore would not warrant the high level of expenditure involved. However, I will re-examine the matter in view of the representations I have received from the fishermen and I will communicate with the Deputy in due course.

asked the Minister for the Gaeltacht if he will now state arising out of Parliamentary Question number 690 of 29 June 1982 that the balance sheet of Údarás na Gaeltachta gives a figure of liability to the Exchequer as at 31 December 1980 of a lesser sum than appears in the Finance Accounts for the Financial Year 1st January to 31 December 1980; and if he agrees with the figure of £41,791,000 as disclosed in the Finance Accounts for the year ended 31 December 1979 presented to both Houses of the Oireachtas pursuant to 17 and 18 Vict. c.94.s. 2 as amended by No. 21 of 1953 and S.I. No. 293 of 1974.

Speaker.hpid: Aire na Gaeltachta (Mr. Flynn) Aire na Gaeltachta (Mr. Flynn)
Speaker.P: Is mar an gcéanna an dliteanais don Státchiste a thaispeántar i gclár comhardaithe Údarás na Gaeltachta ar an 31 Nollaig 1980 agus sna Cuntais Airgeadais a luaitear.

asked the Minister for the Gaeltacht whether he agrees with the opinion expressed on a recent TV programme by a former Chief Executive of Udarás na Gaeltachta, that not one penny of repayable arrears made by the Exchequer to Gaeltarra Éireann will ever be repaid.

Speaker.hpid: Aire na Gaeltachta (Mr. Flynn) Aire na Gaeltachta (Mr. Flynn)
Speaker.P: Is amhlaidh atá foráil mar seo a leanas in alt 23 (2) (c) den Acht um Údarás na Gaeltachta, 1979:

“Ní bheidh aon airleacan a tugadh do Ghaeltarra Éireann tar éis an 1 ú lá d'Aibreán 1965, ná aon airleacan a thabharfar don Údarás inaisíoctha (ná ní bheidh ús iníoctha ar an gcéanna) go dtí cibé dáta a chinnfidh an tAire Airgeadais tar éis comhairle a ghlacadh leis an Aire” .i. le hAire na Gaeltachta.
Níltear tar éis aon dáta a chinneadh faoin bhforáil sin go fóill.
